description: The APA is the leading scientific and professional organization representing psychology in the United States. APA offers evidence-based articles that are backed by peer-reviewed research used by psychologists nationwide. It also sets the ethical and professional standards in the realm of psychology

As the national professional organization for psychiatrists, this association specializes in the diagnosis and medical treatment of mental illness. It provides resources and education on mental disorders, medication, and treatment, including emerging treatment protocols. Research is grounded in the DSM (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual) guidelines and current research, ensuring both relevance and reliability.

NAMI is a grassroots mental health organization focused on advocacy, education, support, and public awareness. Its support is heavily peer-led, with educational programs and mental health literacy initiatives to ensure that all individuals receive the help they need. They combine lived experiences of individuals with professionals, which makes their approach feel relatable, accessible, and reliable for people navigating their unique challenges.

JED was founded to protect the emotional health and prevent suicide, especially among young teens and young adults. They collaborate with high schools and colleges to implement mental health supports, online toolkits, and resources to promote help-seeking behaviors. They provide prevention-focused information tailored for younger individuals, backed by researchers, clinicians, and youth advocates.

This independent nonprofit is focused on transforming the lives of children and families struggling with mental health and learning disorders. They provide educational content on most disorders created by child psychologists and psychiatrists and offer parent guidance, offering a family-inclusive approach to care.

Fountain House pioneered the "clubhouse" model for psychosocial rehabilitation of individuals with serious mental illness.They provide supportive housing, employment programs, and peer-led initaitves. Their model is evidence-based with global implementation. They promote recovery through support systems strengthened by a multidisciplinary social approach.

NIMH is the lead federal agency for research on mental disorders. Their resources are based on scidience evidence and updated to reflect continuous changes in neuroscience, treatment, and policy. They provide mental health statistics and educational content for professionals and indiviudals wanting to learn more.

HelpGuide is a nonprofit mental health resource offering accessible self-help content such as guides on guides on emotional intelligence, grief, depression, trauma, and relationship challenges. Their reliance is backed by collaboration with licened professions and consistent reviewed for accuracy as they base their content on reader-friendly language.

SAMHSA is a federal agency under the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services that leads efforts to advance behavioral health. The national hotliens (ex. 988), prevention programs, and trauma-informed care framworks offers hollitic support to those who need it. Their resources are backed up by public health research, which promotes recovery and culturally sensitive care across diverse backgrounds.
